(c) "Conditions of Contract" means these Conditions of Contract including Appendices forming a part of the Contract.

(e) "Contractor's Equipment" means all apparatus, machinery, vehicles and other things of whatsoever nature required for the carrying out and completion of the Works and the remedying of defects therein other than Plant and Free Issue Items.
(f) "Contractor's Representative" means the person for the time being in office as the Contractor's Representative pursuant to Clause 10.1 (Contractor's Representative).
(g) "Cost" means all expenditure reasonably incurred (or to be incurred), whether on or off the Site, including overhead and similar charges, but does not include profit.
(h) "Defects Liability Period" has the meaning assigned by Clause 21.2 (Defects after Taking Over).
(i) "Employer's Representative" means the person for the time being appointed by the Employer and notified in writing to the Project Manager, the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor to act on behalf of the Employer for the purposes of the Contract to the extent provided for by the said appointment.
(j) "Extended Warranty" means any guarantee or warranty either express or implied whether provided for by the Contract or otherwise which extends beyond the expiry of the relevant Defects Liability Period.
(k) "Final Certificate" means the certificate referred to in Clause 26.4 (Issue of Final Certificates).
(l) "Form of Tender" means the completed, priced and signed form of tender submitted by the Contractor as part of its Tender and forming a part of the Contract.
(m) "Free Issue Items" has the meaning assigned by Clause 6A (Free Issue Items).
(n) "Instructions to Tenderers" means the document entitled instructions to tenderers forming a part of the Contract.
(o) "Interim Certificate" means the certificate referred to in Clause 26.2 (Issue of Interim Certificates).
(p) "Local Currency" means the currency of the Country.
(q) "Nominated Subcontractor" means any person nominated by the Employer (whether in the Contract, pursuant to a power to make such nominations specifically reserved in the Contract or by way of a Variation Order issued pursuant to Clause 22.1 (Variation Orders)) to receive a subcontract from the Contractor for any specified part of the Works when acting within the scope of such subcontract.
(r) "Particular Conditions" means the terms, conditions and provisions set down in Appendix A to these Conditions of Contract.
(s) "Performance Bond" means the bond named in Clause 7.1 (Provision of Bonds) as the Performance Bond.
(t) "Plant" means machinery, apparatus, materials and all other things to be provided by the Contractor under the Contract for incorporation in the Works including the supply-only items (if any) to be supplied by the Contractor under the Contract.
(u) "Portion of the Works" means a part of a Section of the Works or a part of another Portion of the Works which part, in each case, may from time to time be designated as such by the Employer and notified in writing to the Project Manager, the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor. The residue of the said Section of the Works or said other Portion of the Works shall itself automatically constitute a Portion of the Works.

(w) "Project Manager's Representative" means any representative of the Project Manager appointed from time to time by the Project Manager under Clause 2.5 (Project Manager's Representative).
(x) "Provisional Sum" has the meaning assigned by Clause 22A.1 (Definition of Provisional Sum).
(y) "Site" means the place or places provided or made available by the Employer where work is to be done by the Contractor, or to which Plant or Free Issue Items are to be delivered together with so much of the area surrounding the same as the Contractor shall with the written consent of the Project Manager use in connection with the Works otherwise than merely for the purposes of access.
(z) "Specification" means the document entitled specification forming a part of the Contract together with any modifications thereof or additions thereto or deletions therefrom as may from time to time be made in accordance with the Contract.
(aa) "Subcontractor" means any Nominated Subcontractor or any person to whom any part of the Works has been sublet by the Contractor with (where required in accordance with Clause 3.2 (Subletting)) the consent in writing of the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant and includes the Subcontractor's legal successors but not assigns.
(bb) "Supervision Consultant's Representative" means any representative of the Supervision Consultant appointed from time to time by the Supervision Consultant under Clause 2A.5 (Supervision Consultant's Representative).
(cc) "Suspension Order" has the meaning assigned by Clause 18.1 (Suspension Order).
(dd) "Taking-Over Certificate" has the meaning assigned by Clause 20.1 (Taking-Over Certificate).
(ee) "Tender" means the Contractor's priced offer to the Employer for the carrying out and completion of the Works and the remedying of defects therein.
(ff) "Tests on Completion" means such tests to be made by the Contractor before the relevant Section or Portion of the Works is taken over by the Employer as are provided for in the Contract or otherwise agreed between the Employer or the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor.
(gg) "Variation Order" has the meaning assigned by Clause 22.1 (Variation Orders).
(hh) "Works" means all Plant to be provided and work to be done by the Contractor under the Contract.

heading: 6A.1
text:
The expression "Free Issue Items" shall mean those items (if any) to be provided by the Employer for incorporation in the Works by the Contractor under the Contract.
Collection and Taking Delivery
clause_text:
The expression "Free Issue Items" shall mean those items (if any) to be provided by the Employer for incorporation in the Works by the Contractor under the Contract.
Collection and Taking Delivery

heading: 6A.2
text:
(a) The Employer shall make the Free Issue Items available for collection by the Contractor or shall deliver (or shall arrange for others to deliver) the Free Issue Items to the Contractor as described in the Specification.
(b) The Contractor shall collect or take delivery of (as applicable) the Free Issue Items from the Employer at the points of collection or delivery described in the Specification.
(c) The Contractor shall inspect Free Issue Items at the said points prior to collection or immediately upon taking delivery as applicable and shall promptly notify the Project Manager with a copy to the Employer of any shortage, defect or damage. Such notification shall be accompanied by full details of the said shortage, defect or damage. After the receipt of any such notification, the Project Manager may arrange for the Employer himself to take all necessary steps to rectify the said shortage, defect or damage or may instruct the Contractor in writing to carry out such rectification as a variation under Clause 22 (Variations). All additional Costs to the Employer as determined by the Project Manager arising from any failure by the Contractor to so notify the Project Manager at the time of collection or taking delivery (as applicable) as aforesaid of any such shortage, defect or damage shall be recoverable from the Contractor by the Employer as a debt due from the Contractor, or may be deducted by the Employer from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor. Any delays in the carrying out and completion of the Works arising from such failure by the Contractor shall be the responsibility of the Contractor.
(d) The Contractor shall acknowledge in writing to the Project Manager the collection or taking delivery of (as applicable) the Free Issue Items by the Contractor.

text:

The Contractor shall appoint a full time Safety Officer at the Site, responsible on behalf of the Contractor for maintaining the safety, and protection against accidents, of all persons on the Site and its surroundings. text:

•	12.1 The legal title to any item of Plant provided or to be provided pursuant to the Contract shall pass to the Employer upon the first to occur of the following events, namely

•	18.1 The Contractor shall, on the written order of the Project Manager stating the date of suspension and bearing the written consent of the Employer (herein referred to as a "Suspension Order"), suspend the progress of the Works or any part thereof for such time or times and in such manner as the Project Manager may consider necessary and shall during such suspension properly protect, store and secure the Works or such part thereof against damage to the satisfaction of the Project Manager.

•	(a) otherwise provided for in the Contract, or
•	(b) necessary by reason of some default of or breach of contract by the Contractor, or
•	(c) necessary by reason of an occurrence of the forces of nature which an experienced contractor should have foreseen and provided for (for the purposes of this Sub-Clause (c) rainfall in any quantity shall be deemed to be such an occurrence), or

•	19A.1 The Contractor shall carry out the Tests on Completion in accordance with the Contract to the satisfaction of the Supervision Consultant. •	(a) order the Contractor in writing to repeat the Test or Tests concerned; and/or

heading: TAKING OVER
text:
Taking-Over Certificate
•	20.1 When:
•	(a) any Section or Portion of the Works has been completed in accordance with the Contract, except for any minor outstanding work and defects which will not affect the use of that Section or Portion of the Works for its intended purpose (either until or whilst such work is completed and such defects are remedied); and
•	(b) all Tests on Completion in respect of that Section or Portion of the Works have been duly passed to the satisfaction of the Supervision Consultant; and
•	(c) paragraph (a) of Clause 5.7 (As-built Drawings, Operations and Maintenance Manuals) has been fully complied with in respect of that Works; and
•	(d) all the other conditions precedent to the issue of a Taking-Over Certificate in respect of that Section or Portion of the Works as required by the Contract have been satisfied; the Contractor shall give notice in writing to the Project Manager, (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant and to the Employer), that the aforesaid Section or Portion of the Works is ready for taking over, such notice being accompanied by a written undertaking to complete any minor outstanding work and remedy any minor outstanding defects as mentioned above as soon as practicable during the Defects Liability Period.

•	21.4 If the work carried out by the Contractor pursuant to any notice from the Supervision Consultant under Clause 21.2 is such that any of the Tests on Completion should be repeated, the Supervision Consultant may, either in his notice to remedy the relevant defect or by a subsequent written notice, require the Contractor to repeat the same and Clause 19A shall apply thereto with any necessary changes.

•	21.5 Save as may be necessary for remedying any defect or for making any search required by the Supervision Consultant under Clause 21.7 or finishing any work related to any respect in which the relevant Section or Portion of the Works was not completed at the time of issue of the Taking-Over Certificate, the Contractor shall not, and its employees, representatives, agents, Subcontractors and visitors shall not, enter any Section or Portion of the Works after issue of the Taking-Over Certificate. Access by the Contractor shall be allowed where necessary for those purposes subject to reasonable security restrictions.

•	21.6 If after the Supervision Consultant has given the Contractor any notice under Clause 21.2 the Contractor does not commence and carry out the necessary remedying work with due expedition, the Employer may itself carry out or employ others to carry out the work at the Contractor's risk and cost, with the Project Manager determining such Costs.

•	21.7 The Contractor shall, if required by the Supervision Consultant in writing, search under the directions of the Supervision Consultant for the cause of any defect appearing during the progress of the Works or during the Defects Liability Period. The Cost of the work carried out in searching shall be determined by the Project Manager and the Contractor shall be paid such Cost in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates). If such defect is one of the Costs of remedying which the Contractor is liable to bear, the Cost shall be borne by the Contractor.
Application to Extended Warranties
•	21.8 Clauses 21.4 to 21.7 inclusive shall also apply in relation to any Extended Warranty but with such changes as may be necessary for the purpose.

heading: VARIATIONS
text:
Variation Orders
•	22.1 The Employer may from time to time during the currency of the Contract by written order direct the Contractor to alter, amend, omit, add to or otherwise vary the Works or any part thereof or to change any sequence or timing of construction of any part of the Works specified in the Contract and the Contractor shall be bound to carry out such Variation Order as if the provisions of the same had been incorporated into the Contract. The Contractor shall not alter, amend, omit, add to or otherwise vary the Works or any part thereof or change any sequence or timing of construction of any part of the Works specified in the Contract in any way whatsoever except as directed by a Variation Order.
•	The effect, if any, of all such Variation Orders shall be valued in accordance with Clause 22.3 (Valuation of Variation Orders) provided that where the variation Order is necessitated by some default of or breach of contract by the Contractor or for which it is responsible, any additional Costs attributable to such default or breach shall be borne by the Contractor.
Effect on Programme
•	22.2 Forthwith after receiving any Variation Order the Contractor shall proceed with the carrying out thereof and shall within the period required by the Project Manager notify the Project Manager in writing whether in the Contractor's opinion the Variation Order will result in any need to revise the Programme and, if in the Contractor's opinion there is such a need, the said written notification shall be accompanied by a proposed revised programme for the approval of the Project Manager. The Contractor shall not delay carrying out the Variation Order pending determination of the value of the Variation Order or pending approval of any proposed revised programme. Nor shall the Contractor delay pending the grant of any consequent extension of the Time for Completion to which the Contractor may be entitled in accordance with Clause 19.2 (Extensions of Time).
Valuation of Variation Orders
•	22.3 As soon as practicable after the issue of any Variation Order the value thereof shall be determined as follows:
•	(a) the Variation Order shall be valued at rates and prices contained in the Contract insofar as such rates and prices shall be appropriate and applicable; and
•	(b) insofar as the Variation Order cannot be valued in accordance with Clause 22.3(a) above the Employer and the Contractor shall endeavour to agree a suitable valuation; or
•	(c) in the event of failure to agree as aforesaid the Employer shall fix a valuation which, in its opinion, is appropriate and shall notify the Contractor accordingly with a copy to the Project Manager.
•	Until such time as a valuation is agreed or fixed, the Project Manager shall after consultation with the Employer and the Contractor determine a provisional valuation to enable on-account payments to be included in certificates issued in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates).
•	The Contractor shall submit to the Employer all such documents, evidence and calculations as the Employer shall require for agreeing a suitable valuation under Clause 22.3(b).
Dayworks
•	22.4 The Employer may instruct that any varied work shall be carried out on a daywork basis. The Contractor shall be paid for such varied work in accordance with the Dayworks Bill forming part of the Bills of Quantities and at the rates and prices stated in such Bill. The Contractor shall submit daywork sheets, in duplicate, daily, showing details as required, and the Project Manager shall sign an adjusted copy. At the end of each month the Contractor shall submit duplicate statements of daywork carried out, with full details and supporting documents. The Contractor shall not be entitled to payment for daywork unless the daywork sheets and supporting documents have been fully and punctually rendered. Where sending daywork documents was impracticable, the Employer may still authorise payment for the relevant portion of the Works on a daywork basis or at a fair value.
Value Engineering
•	22.5 The Contractor may at any time submit proposals for Value Engineering that could accelerate completion, improve performance, reduce cost, or otherwise benefit the Employer, with appropriate revisions to programme and Time for Completion and valuation.

heading: PROVISIONAL SUMS
text:
Definition of Provisional Sum
•	22A.1 "Provisional Sum" means a sum (if any) included in the Contract Sum and so designated in the Bills of Quantities for work to be done and/or Plant to be provided, such sum being an estimate of the value of such work and/or Plant.
Valuation of Provisional Sums
•	22A.2 The value of work done and/or Plant provided to which Provisional Sums relate shall be determined in accordance with the Bills of Quantities and the Particular Conditions and the Contractor shall be paid such value in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates).
Nomination
•	22A.3 In respect of each part of the Works (if any) covered by a Provisional Sum in the Bills of Quantities or defined in the Contract as an optional scope the Employer shall nominate the person to receive a subcontract from the Contractor for such part of the Works and shall notify the Contractor of such nomination.
Competitive Tendering
•	22A.4 In respect of each part of the Works (if any) covered by a Provisional Sum in the Bills of Quantities which is described therein as to be subject to competitive tendering, the following provisions shall apply:
•	(a) The Contractor shall obtain competitive tenders from tenderers approved by the Employer and shall submit for the approval of the Employer a list of proposed tenderers. The Contractor shall include in its lists of tenderers any firms proposed by the Employer.
•	(b) [TEXT CORRUPTED – REVIEW]
•	(c) The tender documents shall be prepared by the Contractor and shall be submitted to the Employer for review and comment (with the tender documents being amended by the Contractor to take into account any such comments) prior to issue by the Contractor to tenderers. Such tender documents shall advise tenderers that whilst tenders are to be addressed to the Contractor, they are to be delivered directly to the Employer in plain envelopes or parcels with wax seals marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee and are not to be copied to the Contractor. Such tender documents shall include without limitation the provisions stated in the Particular Conditions as to be included in such documents. The Contractor shall provide the Employer with copies of any addenda, tender bulletins, tender circulars and the like in relation to such tender documents at the same time as they are issued by the Contractor to tenderers.
•	The tenders shall be opened in private by the Tender Committee of the Employer and a copy passed to the Contractor for evaluation. The Contractor shall submit its evaluation of both the technical and commercial aspects of the tenders to the Employer marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee together with its recommendations as to the tenderer to be awarded the subcontract.
•	(d) Following the conclusion of the tender evaluation process, the Contractor shall obtain the written approval of the Employer to enter into a subcontract with the selected tenderer and following the receipt of such approval the Contractor shall enter into a subcontract with the approved tenderer. Provided that the Contractor shall submit the proposed subcontract documents to the Employer for review and comment and shall amend such document to take into account any such comments prior to entering into the said subcontract. The comments and approvals given by the Employer and the involvement of the Employer, the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant in the tendering process pursuant to this Clause 22A.4 shall not release the Contractor from any of its obligations or liabilities under the Contract.

heading: CLAIMS
text:
•	23.1 Notice of Claims
•	Notwithstanding any other provision of the Contract, if the Contractor intends to make a claim against the Employer for any additional payment in connection with or arising out of the Contract or the Works or any Section or Portion thereof other than a claim for a payment of or on account of any Variation Order issued pursuant to Clause 22.1 (Variation Orders), the Contractor shall give notice in writing thereof to the Project Manager, with a copy to the Employer, as soon as possible and in any event within twenty eight (28) days after the event or circumstance giving rise to the claim has first occurred. Such notice shall contain full and detailed particulars of and information concerning such claim insofar as those particulars are or that information is then known to it or reasonably available to it. Such particulars and information shall without limitation include the grounds upon which such claim is based, the Contractor's then estimate as to the amount of the aforesaid claim and details of the build-up of such estimate. The claims to which this Clause 23.1 applies shall without limitation include any claims for extra Cost under Clause 18.1 (Suspension Order) and in those cases the notice given under this Clause 23.1 shall fulfill the requirements of that Clause concerning notice of intention to claim.
•	23.2 Notice of Further Particulars or Information
•	As soon as the Contractor becomes aware of any particulars of or other information concerning any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1 the Contractor shall give notice in writing thereof to the Project Manager containing full details including, without limitation, any revision to the Contractor's previous estimate as to the amount of the aforesaid claim and details of the revision.
•	23.3 Contemporary Records
•	Whenever an event or circumstance occurs which gives rise to a claim as provided in Clause 23.1 the Contractor shall keep full and detailed contemporary records of and relating to all matters relevant to any such claim either on the Site or at another location acceptable to the Project Manager. The Project Manager shall be entitled to inspect such contemporary records and require copies.
•	23.4 Current Estimates
•	The Project Manager shall be entitled to require the Contractor to deliver its then latest estimate as to the amount of any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1.
•	23.5 Comprehensive Claim
•	Within twenty eight (28) days, or such extended time as the Project Manager may allow, of giving notice under Clause 23.1, the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager a comprehensive account of the claim with full and detailed particulars. Such particulars shall incorporate prior submissions (Clauses 23.1–23.4). The Contractor shall thereafter promptly provide any further particulars the Project Manager may require.
•	23.6 Failure to Comply
•	If the Contractor fails to comply with Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) or subsequent related sub-clauses, the Contractor shall not be entitled to any additional payment in respect of the claim, and the Employer shall be discharged from liability. Otherwise, non-compliance with later sub-clauses may limit payment to the extent verified by contemporary records.
•	23.7 Determination of Claims
•	When the comprehensive account and any required particulars have been provided, the Project Manager shall determine the amount (if any) to be paid and the Contractor shall be paid that amount in accordance with Clause 26.
•	23.8 Exclusion of Small Claims
•	Notwithstanding the above, any such claim shall only be valid if (a) unforeseeable by an experienced contractor at tender date; (b) fully substantiated; and (c) not less than the amount stated in the Particular Conditions when aggregated with related claims.
